items.summary: The prime minister and opposition leader have both condemned the alleged attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally more than a week ago, after police revealed it was being prosecuted as a terror incident.

items.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
items.summary: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

items.title: Bunnings wins fight to use AI facial recognition tech to combat store crime, opening door for other retailers
items.summary: Bunnings was reasonably entitled to use AI facial recognition technology to combat crime and staff abuse in its stores, the Administrative Review Tribunal finds.

items.title: More than 200 Daly River residents evacuated amid flood threat, with most staying at Darwin's Foskey Pavilion
items.summary: Hundreds of Daly River residents have been evacuated to Darwin ahead of expected major flooding, with Foskey Pavilion set up to accommodate most of the evacuees.

items.title: Old Spirit ferries up sale with new berth 'on track' for October launch, TT-Line says
items.summary: Ferry operator TT-Line is confident its two new Spirit of Tasmania vessels will begin operating by October — but it says there is a "risk" its existing ships might not be sold by then.

items.title: Mother of autistic children shares experience in wake of suspected double murder-suicide
items.summary: A mother of two autistic children living in regional Western Australia has shared her experience of navigating bureaucracy while caring for children with complex needs.

items.title: Andrew Hastie reads Art of War, Pauline Hanson returns
items.summary: The calamity unfolding in the dissolved Coalition provided a convenient distraction for the government, which should have had a worse week amid an interest rate hike.

items.title: Families respond after Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing inquest findings released
items.summary: Loved ones of victims Ashlee Good and Jade Young have fought back tears responding to findings from the high-profile inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing.

items.title: ACTU pushing 'above-inflation' wage increase in 2026 as real paypackets decline
items.summary: Australia's biggest employers are under pressure to give their workers pay increases above 4 per cent this year, as real wages go backwards and the union movement ramps up pressure.

items.title: AFL integrity unit looking into why police visited Melbourne Demons player Steven May
items.summary: Melbourne veteran Steven May is being investigated by the AFL integrity unit, as the premiership defender stays away from Demons training.

items.title: Private health insurers take aim at rising specialists fees
items.summary: A survey of 4,000 patients finds more than half had an unexpected cost when under a specialist's care.

items.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
items.summary: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

items.title: Invasion Day bomb declared terror act, as accused's 'pro-white ideology' probed
items.summary: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

items.title: Gus disappearance declared major crime, suspect identified
items.summary: South Australian police have declared the disappearance of Gus Lamont a major crime and say a person who has lived at his outback property is now considered a suspect, but have stressed that the boy's parents are not under investigation.

items.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
items.summary: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

items.title: Two people in custody after alleged Huon Valley home invasion
items.summary: Police take two people into custody in relation to an alleged early morning home invasion and firearms theft in the Huon Valley.

items.title: Australians in Japan say ski fields are safe after spate of deaths
items.summary: Australians working in Japan's ski fields say while the sport has unpredictable risks, there are ways to be prepared.

items.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
items.summary: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

items.title: Worker's death at Tanami gold mine in Central Australia under investigation
items.summary: A 47-year-old worker has died following an incident at the Tanami gold mine in remote Central Australia, with police and NT WorkSafe investigating.

items.title: Sydney man, 19, charged over alleged threats to kill Israeli president
items.summary: Darcy Tinning was arrested by AFP officers on Wednesday and charged with making a threat to kill an "internationally protected person".

items.title: NRL rookie Sebastian Su'a poised for breakout year after injury-plagued 2025 season with Dolphins
items.summary: The work ethic of a former Test fast bowler and the mentoring of an elite prop are inspiring Dolphins rookie Sebastian Su'a's NRL quest.

items.title: Donald Trump, gold, interest rates and AI data centres to dominate company reporting season

items.title: What are data centres and what do they mean for regional Victoria?

items.title: Pauline Hanson returns to Senate seat after seven-day suspension — as it happened

items.title: 'Ironic' and 'lazy' AI-generated images shared on Queensland government department social media accounts

items.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
items.summary: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

items.summary: A confrontation caught on body-worn security footage in the halls of the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit highlights concerns raised by local mothers.

items.title: Report points to exploitation, Medicare and visa concerns in Pacific islander jobs scheme

items.title: Online safety watchdog says tech giants failing to detect child abuse
items.summary: Major tech companies including Apple, Google, Meta and Microsoft are still failing to do enough to detect and stop child sexual abuse, eSafety has claimed.

items.title: A 'ghost airport' and sinkhole highway as Timor-Leste gambles on oil and gas with Greater Sunrise project
items.summary: The Greater Sunrise gas project was meant to transform Timor-Leste and bring billions in revenue, but locals are still waiting for the jobs and opportunities that were promised.

items.title: 'Bloodbath' at Washington Post as massive layoffs announced

items.title: Winter Olympics quiz: How well are you prepared for the Games?

items.title: Australia announces Jakara Anthony, Matt Graham as 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics flag bearers

items.title: What is India’s Nipah virus and should Australians be worried?

items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?

items.title: Living costs rise for all but some hit harder, new ABS data finds
items.summary: Cost-of-living pressures are being felt by all households, but some have been hit harder than others as annual costs increased between 2.3 and 4.2 per cent in 2025, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

items.title: World's fastest falcon spotted in Central Australian outback for the first time

items.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
items.summary: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

items.title: Why these women took marriage sabbaticals — and how it went
items.summary: Do you ever feel like taking a break from your marriage? Three women share how a marriage sabbatical changed their relationship.

items.title: Scammers staged a fake AFP set in a Cambodian compound. Here's what we know

items.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
items.summary: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

items.title: NSW parliamentary inquiry to investigate mould and maggot issues at Newcastle's Mater Hospital
items.summary: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

items.title: Trump's failure to extend nuclear treaty leaves door 'wide open' to arms race
items.summary: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between the United States and Russia has come to an end at a time of global instability.

items.title: Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim and India's Narendra Modi named in Epstein files
items.summary: The prime ministers of Malaysia and India deny having links with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein after their names appeared in a tranche of files released by the US Department of Justice.

items.title: Report finds NT residents feel less safe and less satisfied with police despite crime crackdown
items.summary: A new report reveals NT residents felt less safe over the past year, despite a government crackdown on crime.

items.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
items.summary: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

items.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson
items.summary: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

items.title: Demons defender Steven May misses AFL pre-season training
items.summary: Melbourne Demons veteran Steven May was not at training for his club on Wednesday, just six weeks out from the start of the 2026 AFL season.

items.title: Defence Department announces plans to sell off Leeuwin and Irwin Barracks in Perth
items.summary: The Department of Defence announces plans to sell off both Leeuwin and Irwin barracks, freeing up dozens of hectares of residential land in prime Perth suburbs.

items.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
items.summary: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

items.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
items.summary: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

items.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
items.summary: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.

items.title: Western Australia's oldest lighthouse at risk from coastal erosion in Geraldton
items.summary: The Point Moore lighthouse has kept seafarers safe along the unforgiving Batavia Coast since 1878, but a maritime historian says there needs to be a firm plan to protect it from future erosion and rising sea levels.

items.title: Travel blogger called out for visit to asbestos-ridden former Wittenoom town site with young daughter
items.summary: Asbestos disease advocates criticise a Queensland blogger for taking her daughter to one of Australia's most contaminated sites.

items.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah to appear at one-off Adelaide literary festival Constellations
items.summary: Palestinian Australian author, lawyer and activist Randa Abdel-Fattah will be appearing at the one-off literary event created to fill the void left by the cancellation of this year's Adelaide Writers' Week, organisers have announced.

items.title: Survival expert praises WA family's calm decision-making during miracle Geographe Bay rescue
items.summary: "Outback Mike" Atkinson says the Appelbee family's ability to stay calm and make smart decisions was critical to their survival after they were swept out to sea off Geographe Bay.

items.title: Forestry industry sounds alarm over 'cheap' timber imports landing in Australia and threatening jobs
items.summary: Imported timber is coming into Australia at nearly half the price of domestically manufactured products and is increasingly being used in local homes.

items.title: Australia knocked out of under-19 Cricket World Cup by England
items.summary: Ollie Peake's hobbling and defiant captain's knock of 100 has proved too little too late to rescue Australia as their reign as under-19 World Cup champions was ended by England in a compelling semifinal in Zimbabwe.

items.summary: From shaping to tuning — how much do you know about how an acoustic guitar is made?

items.title: Extreme heat will make Northern Territory unlivable within 40 years, activists warn
items.summary: The Climate Justice Alliance says rising temperatures and increasingly severe heatwaves present a direct and immediate threat to people across the Territory, particularly in the Top End.

items.title: Donald Trump says Republicans should 'nationalise' US elections
items.summary: Donald Trump says he wants Republicans to "nationalise" US elections and has encouraged his party to "take over the voting" in at least some parts of the country.
